channel.title: Wifi card (Driver?) auto-disables after computer restart :S
channel.description:
Well, this has been rather annoying, and I hardly restart my computer because of it. Every time I restart my computer, it connects back to the internet for about 45 seconds to 2 minutes, then the wifi card shut's itself off. I can't say why it does, as I've tried everything I could to fix it (that I know of).
Specs: Windows 7 Home Premium x64 bit 6GB RAM Intel Core i3-2350M CPU @2.30GHz Samsung maker (it was cheaper then others XD)
Wifi Card: Intel Centrino Advanced-N 6235
What I've tried: Using the Easy Settings (Made by Samsung) to change the card to 'on' and it maintain that setting on restart. ^ But opposite. Updating Drivers. Changing the settings in Msconfig Changing the settings using CCleaner Using intel as the wifi manager.
I'm out of ideas. Anyone?

item.title: Wifi card (Driver?) auto-disables after computer restart :S
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Correct me if I’m wrong then, but the only thing I can think of right now is that it is an internal problem. I’ll still do some research on it, but get it checked.

Read full topic

Yep, double checked that

item.source: Wifi card (Driver?) auto-disables after computer restart :S

item.title: Wifi card (Driver?) auto-disables after computer restart :S
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:4, topic:481690”]And just in case, here’s some more info from the Microsoft help forums:

Going into device manager and unchecking the power saver on the adaptor itself has fixed this problem in the past. Or maybe putting check marks in both places will help, hard to say because they all react different to this adjustment. It's considered to be a driver problem so updating or finding a better driver for your network adaptor might help but unchecking the power saving feature can also work.
Check this picture out for reference.[/quote]
Didn’t work. :s

Read full topic
item.source: Wifi card (Driver?) auto-disables after computer restart :S

item.title: Wifi card (Driver?) auto-disables after computer restart :S
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

And just in case, here’s some more info from the Microsoft help forums:

Going into device manager and unchecking the power saver on the adaptor itself has fixed this problem in the past. Or maybe putting check marks in both places will help, hard to say because they all react different to this adjustment. It's considered to be a driver problem so updating or finding a better driver for your network adaptor might help but unchecking the power saving feature can also work.
Check this picture out for reference.

Read full topic

Edit: everything is set to on/allow.

item.title: Wifi card (Driver?) auto-disables after computer restart :S
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well, this has been rather annoying, and I hardly restart my computer because of it. Every time I restart my computer, it connects back to the internet for about 45 seconds to 2 minutes, then the wifi card shut’s itself off. I can’t say why it does, as I’ve tried everything I could to fix it (that I know of).

Specs:
Windows 7 Home Premium x64 bit
6GB RAM
Intel Core i3-2350M CPU @2.30GHz
Samsung maker (it was cheaper then others XD)

Wifi Card:
Intel Centrino Advanced-N 6235

What I’ve tried:
Using the Easy Settings (Made by Samsung) to change the card to ‘on’ and it maintain that setting on restart.
^ But opposite.
Updating Drivers.
Changing the settings in Msconfig
Changing the settings using CCleaner
Using intel as the wifi manager.

I’m out of ideas. Anyone?
